question: It is true that a file is a collection of data stored on a computer.
It is false that a file can only contain text data.
It is true that a file can store text, images, videos, and programs.
It is false that all files are readable by humans.
It is true that a file name is an attribute of a file.
It is false that file attributes do not store any metadata.
It is true that file attributes include size, type, and creation date.
It is false that a file type is not an important attribute.
It is true that the location of a file refers to its path in the system.
It is false that file permissions determine who can access a file.
It is true that file operations include creating, reading, writing, and deleting files.
It is false that copying a file removes it from the original location.
It is true that renaming a file changes only its name, not its content.
It is false that deleting a file means it cannot be recovered in any way.
It is true that a text file contains human-readable content.
It is false that a binary file is always readable in Notepad.
It is true that a .jpg file is an example of a binary file.
It is false that an .mp4 file is a text file.
It is true that an executable file (.exe) is used to run a program.
It is false that a .docx file is a binary file.
It is true that a file system organizes and manages files on a computer.
It is false that file systems are unnecessary for managing data storage.
It is true that a file system uses directories to organize files.
It is false that a file system does not include file paths.
It is true that the root directory is the highest-level directory in a file system.
It is false that the C:\ drive is an example of a file path in Windows.
It is true that file systems determine how data is stored and accessed.
It is false that storage media such as hard drives and SSDs do not use file systems.
It is true that the File Allocation Table (FAT) keeps track of file locations.
It is false that a file cannot be moved from one directory to another.
It is true that moving a file changes its location but keeps its content intact.
It is false that a file must always remain in the same directory after being created.
It is true that file permissions control who can read, write, or execute a file.
It is false that all users have equal access to all files on a system.
It is true that an operating system manages file operations.
It is false that a computer can function without a file system.
It is true that file systems help in preventing data loss and corruption.
It is false that a deleted file cannot be recovered from the recycle bin.
It is true that a .csv file is used to store structured data in a table format.
It is false that a .mp3 file is used for storing images.
It is true that a .html file is used for creating web pages.
It is false that the size of a file is not a file attribute.
It is true that the owner of a file can set permissions for other users.
It is false that a .exe file contains only text data.
It is true that the modification date of a file changes when it is edited.
It is false that a fileâ€™s creation date changes every time it is accessed.
It is true that a file path indicates the exact location of a file in the system.
It is false that file operations do not include renaming a file.
It is true that a .wav file is an example of an audio file.
It is false that a file system is not necessary for organizing files.
